name: McLaren 650S GT3
description: The McLaren 650S GT3 is a GT3-class car with a 495 horsepower 3.8 litre twin turbo V8 engine.

name: Bentley Continental GT3
description: The Bentley Continental GT3 is a large-bodied lightweight GT3-class car with a 600 horsepower 4.0 litre twin turbo engine.

name: Callaway Corvette C7 GT3-R
description: The Callaway Corvette C7 GT3-R is a GT3-class car with a 600 horsepower 6.1 litre V8 engine.

name: Mercedes AMG GT3
description: The Mercedes AMG GT3 is a GT3-class car with a 550 horsepower 6.3 litre naturally aspirated V8 engine.

name: Radical RXC Turbo GT3
description: The Radical RXC Turbo GT3 is a stiff and light open-cockpit GT3-class car with a 500 horsepower Ford Ecoboost V6 3.5 litre twin turbo engine.

name: Formula E 2018 Car
description: Experience the Official 2018 Formula E car, using regen and power modes and featuring the 2018 Formula E team liveries.

name: Hong Kong E-Prix Track
description: Welcome to the Official 2017 HKT Hong Kong E-Prix track. Based around the Central Harbourfront, the tight and twisty 1.86km track provides a huge challenge against the backdrop of Hong Kong's iconic sights.

name: KartSim Rental Kart
description: The Rental Kart from KartSim.

name: KartSim X30 Kart
description: The Iame Senior X30 Kart from KartSim.

name: KartSim Buckmore Park International Circuit
description: The Buckmore Park International Circuit from KartSim.

name: KartSim Paul Fletcher International
description: The Paul Fletcher International track from KartSim.

name: KartSim Glan Y Gors
description: The Glan Y Gors track from KartSim.

name: Corvette C7.R
description: The Chevrolet Corvette C7.R built by Pratt & Miller and Chevrolet for competition in endurance racing has had numerous successes throughout the years including a famous photo-finish at the 2106 Rolex 24h of Daytona.

name: Porsche 911 RSR
description: Another iconic car from Porsche, the 911 RSR combines technology and history to create another classic sports car. The car is used in endurance in the GTE class all over the world.

name: BMW M8 GTE
description: The BMW M8 GTE competes in multiple endurance series, combining cutting-edge technology with sheer beauty to create a car that will set new benchmarks in endurance racing.

name: Norma M30 LMP3
description: The Norma M30 LMP3, developed over 18 months with innovation at the heart. Homologated to LMP3, the M30 boasts maximum efficiency, optimising performance.

name: Oreca 07 LMP2
description: The Oreca 07 LMP2, combining daring engineering and skilfull know-how. Winner of WEC 2017 P2 class and Le Mans 2017 and used by several of the leading endurance teams in the world.

name: Formula E Gen2 2019/2020 Car
description: The outstanding Formula E Gen2 car has been upgraded to include the 2020 liveries alongside those of 2019! A complete redesign to the Gen1 cars, the Gen2 car features more power and longevity, boasting double the energy storage capacity of the Gen1 car, meaning it can complete a whole race without having to change car mid-race. With 250 kW of power, the Gen2 will accelerate from 0-100 km/h in 2.8 seconds and go on to a top speed of 280 km/h.

name: McLaren 720S GT3
description: To bring one of their new incredible cars onto race tracks, McLaren developed the stunning 720S GT3. Modern design, impressive aerodynamics and years of experience in Motorsport should help this car to claim wins among several premier GT3 events in 2019.

name: BMW M6 GT3
description: From the very start, the BMW M6 GT3 hit the grids all over the motorsport world and proved the V8 concept to the German manufacturer. Leading several Endurance events in different series and also claiming the 2018 FIA GT Worldcup title, this car is a winner.

name: Porsche 911 GT3 R
description: It probably wouldn't be called motorsport if the iconic brand Porsche wouldn't be part of a class. The 911 GT3 R is once again a very balanced, race-proven car by the German manufacturer, reinforcing their image as being amongst the highest rated contenders of a series.

name: Audi R8 LMS GT3
description: Considered as one of the all-time favourites, this midship RWD car by Audi has been competing in GT3 since the beginning, winning significant races around the globe for a variety of teams. A demanding but rewarding choice.

name: Aston Martin Vantage GT3
description: The second generation of the Aston Martin Vantage GT3 is ready for some serious racing action. It will enter GT events in 2019 and beefs up the already stunning road version of the Vantage. With the prestige and expertise Aston Martin brings into racing, it's a challenger you always have to keep an eye on.

name: Imola
description: The Autodromo Enzo e Dino Ferrari di Imola, better known as Imola, has hosted both the Italian and San Marino Grand Prix 28 times in total. This rF2 track comes in four versions: the classic, dangerous 1972 layout surrounded by nearby barriers before te introduction of chicanes to reduce its high speed nature, the 1988 layout that introduced a few chicanes, the 2001 layout with further modifications and chicanes and finally, the current configuration fully adapted to modern standards but still retaining a lot of the unique challenges that made it famous.

name: Virginia International Raceway
description: Virginia International Raceway (commonly known as 'VIR') is a race track located in Alton, Virginia VIR is an incredibly beautiful and diverse racetrack allowing for numerous configurations, suiting all types of categories from small club cars to big GT and powerful prototypes.

name: Guapore
description: Autódromo Internacional de Guaporé is a motorsports circuit in Guaporé, a small city in southern Brazil. It is one of the oldest race tracks in the country and traditionally hosts a variety of different categories, ranging from Classic tintops, modern endurance prototypes to racing trucks.

name: Ibarra
description: The Autódromo Internacional de Yahuarcocha, is located in Ibarra, Ecuador. It´s unique layout flowing around and in between a lake, mountains and even a vulcan makes it an unique driving experience.

name: Formula Vee
description: This popular trainer formula car is heavily based on parts from the classic VW Beetle. Its open differential and swing axle rear suspension makes it a constant challenge and ideal tool to develop your driving skills.

name: MCR Sports 2000
description: The MCR S2000 is an incredibly nimble 500kg british prototype features an I4 Duratec engine, and is popular racer both for its driving fun as well as close wheel-to-wheel races.

name: MetalMoro AJR
description: The AJR is the latest high-performance prototype from Brazilian manufacturer Metalmoro. Capable matching the performance of a modern LMP2 car, this versatile prototype can be used with a range of different engines - the rF2 version features versions with Honda K20 I4 Turbo, Powertec V8, Chevrolet V8 and Judd V10.

name: MetalMoro MR18
description: The MR18 is a succesful mid-range endurance prototype from Brazilian manufacturer Metalmoro. It features a Honda K20 I4 Turbo engine.

name: Puma GTE
description: A sensation amongst brazilian car enthusiasts from the 70s, the GTE is a modified version of the VW Beetle, featuring the same mechanics of the brazilian Fusca with a lower, light weight fiberglass bodywork in an iconic design. The rFactor2 version is modelled after the original car and runs on radial tyres.

name: Puma P052
description: The P052 is a modern reimagination of the 70s brazilian classic, it retains many of the pure driving atributes that made the originals so popular in Brazil. The current prototype as modelled in rFactor2 runs with tuned MIVEC engine, 5-speed gearbox and slick tyres.

name: GT3 Pack
description: GT racing its where it's at and with this bundle, you're ready to rock. Choose your favorite GT3 race car from the 11 available in this pack and dominate in the most diverse class out there: Aston Martin Vantage GT3, Audi R8 GT3 2018, Audi R8 GT3 2019, Bentley Continental GT3, BMW M6 GT3, Callaway Corvette GT3-R, McLaren 650S GT3, McLaren 720S GT3, Mercedes AMG GT3, Porsche 911 GT3 R and Radical RXC Turbo GT3.

name: Formula E Bundle
description: Motorsport is an ever-evolving story. Be at the front of it with this pack that is boosting you right into one of the most revolutionary FIA Championship out there. Recreate its beginning with the Gen1 car or dive right into the current season with the Gen2 car and all original liveries, it's up to you which team you take around the 4 included original circuits: Monaco E-Prix, Berlin E-Prix, New York E-Prix and Hong Kong E-Prix.

name: KartSim Pack
description: Introducing KartSim, featuring two highly-accurate fixed-setup karts - the X30 UK Senior Kart and Rental Kart. Test yourself on three famous UK kart tracks, Paul Fletcher International, Buckmore Park and Glan Y Gors all based on laser scanned technology.

name: Endurance Bundle
description: If you're up for one of the biggest challenges in motorsport, this pack is for you. Get prepared for endurance races around the globe with 4 classes. No matter if Prototypes or GTs, it's in here: McLaren Senna GTR, Oreca 07 LMP2, Norma M30 LMP3, Aston Martin Vantage GTE, BMW M8 GTE, Corvette C7.R, Porsche 911 RSR

name: Track Expansion Bundle
description: Some tracks in the world of motorsport have a special status. They are icons, each representing a different kind of challenge but all being recognized as one of the toughest challenges out there. With this bundle, you can take on these adventures yourself. From the unforgiving Green Hell to the bumpy course around a former airfield, the playgrounds are waiting for you. Includes the Nürburgring, Le Mans, Sebring and the Circuit d'Azure.

name: Reiza Pack
description: The Reiza rFactor 2 Bundle is here! This pack includes all Reiza content developed for rFactor 2: a total of 6 vehicles and 4 unique venues in 10 different layouts, mixing world-class race tracks such as Imola and VIR with exotic locations such as Ibarra and Guaporé; powerful modern prototypes such as the Metalmoro AJR with the challenging Formula Vee trainer. The Reiza rF2 Bundle combines the diverse content developed with quality standards and attention to detail Reiza became known for, with rFactor 2´s unique advanced simulation technology for a powerful sim racing experience!

name: Reiza Track Pack
description: This Track pack includes Imola (1972 and 2018 versions), VIR 2018 in 5 different layouts, ecuadorian track Ibarra in 2 layouts as well as the Guaporé Autodrome from southern Brazil.

name: Reiza Car Pack
description: This Car pack includes the Metalmoro AJR in 4 different engine configurations for 20 cars in total, Metalmoro MR18 in a 26-car field, Formula Vee in a 24-car field, MCR S2000 in a 20-car field, Puma GTE in a 10-car field; Puma P052 in a 20-car field.

name: Nurburgring Endurance bundle
description: Nürburgring, Porsche 911 GT3 Cup, BMW M2 CS Racing and Radical SR3-XX. With this new pack we give you a sampler of options to get to know Endurance racing at the Ring! From the more approachable to the more advanced in terms of handling, work your way up and conquer the Green Hell.

name: Monaco E-Prix Track
description: Introducing the awesome Monaco E-Prix 2019, the 1.765 km tight and twisty circuit is known for intense racing, with the Formula E version testing drivers to the max!

name: GT3 Power Pack
description: Your final chance to purchase this bundle with some of the finest GT3 cars at a special discount!

name: GT3 Challenger Pack
description: Your final chance to complete the collection with these five GT3 cars! Aston Martin Vantage, Porsche 911 GT3 R, McLaren 720S, BMW M6 and two different variations of the Audi R8 are waiting for you.

name: Le Mans 24h
description: Introducing the iconic Le Mans 24h for rFactor 2, meticulously recreated, the 2018 track is modelled with millimetre precision using the latest in laser scan technology. Nothing but the best for this epic track. What other sim to bring out its real potential than rFactor 2 with it's heritage with endurance multi-class racing.

name: Two Strong Pack
description: Powerful engines, sophisticated suspensions and aerodynamics that let their work seem magical, that's what is needed to create a race car that can take on the world. Some might say there are even cars that are too strong – welcome to our Two Strong Package - featuring the Aston Martin Vantage GTE and the lightning fast McLaren Senna GTR!

name: Porsche 911 GT3 Cup
description: When it comes to the ultimate customer racecar, the Porsche 911 GT3 Cup is probably high on that list, if not even the leader as in so many races. Used not only in the Porsche Cups around the entire globe, but also in several other racing series including the all famous 24 Hours at the Nürburgring, this Weisssach-masterpiece is a one of a kind. A 3.8-Liter with six cylinders, of course in boxer setting, is pushing this racer in a blink of an eye through every tough corner.

name: BMW M2 CS Racing
description: The BMW M2 CS Racing car is based on the F87 M2, with 3.0L turbo engine producing 550Nm of torque and 350 horsepower. Being built specifically for track usage, it quickly accelerates out of corners and has an engine with a flat power curve from 5000rpm, up to almost 7000rpm. Mid-corner, the M2's well known agility is kept in check by a set of four 285mm wide slicks on 18 inch rims. This is a great car for competitive racing on any track, and it features all the adjustments needed to make it highly competitive.

name: KartSim Adria
description: Alongside the Adria International Raceway lies the Adria Karting Raceway, situated in beautiful Italy, just an hour south of Venice. Built in 2014, it is one of the most modern kart tracks, and hosts many international karting events. The track itself sports a nice looking combination of concrete and colored run-off areas and is just over 1.3 kilometers long.

name: KartSim Kristianstad
description: Located in the south of Sweden is the Kristianstad karting circuit, a 1.2 kilometer long track that was repaved and upgraded to meet the demands of a CIK grade-A circuit in 2012. The track has 16 corners, two chicanes, and a level difference of 6 meters vertically.

name: KartSim Alaharma
description: The Alaharma circuit, sometimes also called the Mika Salo Circuit as it was designed by the former racing driver of the same name, is one of the most beautiful outdoor karting tracks. Located in Finland in the beautiful town of Alahärmä on the banks of the river Lapuanjoki, the 1 kilometer long course winds down the river and has several corners that challenge even the most experienced drivers.

name: Circuit d'Azur
description: Between the beautiful sea, regal casinos and the lifestyle of the fast and famous, it's up to you to carve your name into the tarmac as a winner of this challenging street circuit!

name: KartSim European Track Pack
description: Contains Alaharma, Adria and Kristianstad

name: Berlin E-Prix Track
description: Take on the challenging 2020 Berlin E-Prix circuit, situated at Tempelhof airport, this 1.927 km track allows for great overtakes and intense action.

name: Ferrari 488 GTE
description: The Ferrari 488 GTE is Maranellos choice for the world of endurance racing. Scoring 490 horsepower on the dyno, the 4 liter V8 engine features a bi-turbo setup to create even power across the entire band of revs. Plenty of power to compete for the top positions at the legendary 24 Hours of Le Mans. But power isn't everything when it comes to the Ferrari, a fully tricked out aero package makes sure that the airflow is helping the 488 GTE to build as much downforce as possible.

name: New York E-Prix Track
description: Red Hook at the Brooklyn Harbor hosted the double-header championship finale of the ABB FIA Formula E Season 17/18 as well as 18/19. With the Big Apple as backdrop, this ePrix easily goes onto the 'most iconic stops'-list of the championship. Take on the challenge, 2.32 km of pure street racing while enjoying a unique view of the Statue of Liberty, welcome to New York!

name: Radical SR3 XX
description: The SR3 XX is the evolution of the best-selling race car in the world, the SR3 which was first introduced in 2001. While the styling mostly remained untouched with just a few key elements setting the XX apart from its predecessor, underneath it's an all new track weapon. The first thing noticed by drivers as most prominent change is probably the new steering wheel, functioning basically as the HUB of the car and giving the driver access to all kind of new functionalities to access, evaluate and analyze data, helping to improve on track. The car is still powered by the 4th Gen RPE-Suzuki engine including a dry sump oil system as standard that is hooked up to a six-speed sequential gearbox with paddle shift and auto-blip function and a Quaife limited-slip differential.
